{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Office Assistant",
  "description": "Karbak Ventures Limited (ISO NG19/90729) is an Engineering, Procurement and Construction Company, with approximately two decades of experience in Electro-Mechanical Projects for FMCG companies in West and East Africa. We have vast experience with plant/equipment installation of numerous sizes and complexity and we pride ourselves in the vast capacity built over the years in providing design, procurement and installation support to numerous FMCG firms such as Coca-Cola, Nigeria Breweries, Guinness, Friesland, PZ Wilmar, Murzah Wilmar (Tanzania), Kasapreko (Ghana), etc. and supports for OEMS such Sidel, KHS, Krones, Pentair, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Maintain cleanliness and an organized office environment
	Run errands, such as Buying lunch, delivering documents, picking up supplies etc
	Welcome and greet visitors, employees and clients
	Manage visitors sign-in process
	Direct visitors to appropriate departments or meeting rooms
	Handle incoming calls and route them to appropriate personnel
	Perform data entry, filing, and other clerical tasks as needed
	Support the HR and administrative department with special tasks
	Other duties as assigned by supervisor.


Requirements


	SSCE Holders
	1-2 years of office experience preferred
	Must be very neat
	Excellent organizational and time management skills
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Reliable and punctual with a strong work ethic
	Must be withn the range of 20-30years old
	Female only
	Must stay around Ojodu berger,Ogba and Opic axis


Salary
N60,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitmentkarbakltd@gmail.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&quot;Office Assistant&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Karbak Ven Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190475"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 30000,
      "maxValue": 75000,

    }
  }
}



Office Assistant Job at Karbak Ventures Limited




        
    

        
        Karbak Ventures Limited (ISO NG19/90729) is an Engineering, Procurement and Construction Company, with approximately two decades of experience in Electro-Mechanical Projects for FMCG companies in West and East Africa. We have vast experience with plant/equipment installation of numerous sizes and complexity and we pride ourselves in the vast capacity built over the years in providing design, procurement and installation support to numerous FMCG firms such as Coca-Cola, Nigeria Breweries, Guinness, Friesland, PZ Wilmar, Murzah Wilmar (Tanzania), Kasapreko (Ghana), etc. and supports for OEMS such Sidel, KHS, Krones, Pentair, etc.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Maintain cleanliness and an organized office environment
	Run errands, such as Buying lunch, delivering documents, picking up supplies etc
	Welcome and greet visitors, employees and clients
	Manage visitors sign-in process
	Direct visitors to appropriate departments or meeting rooms
	Handle incoming calls and route them to appropriate personnel
	Perform data entry, filing, and other clerical tasks as needed
	Support the HR and administrative department with special tasks
	Other duties as assigned by supervisor.


Requirements


	SSCE Holders
	1-2 years of office experience preferred
	Must be very neat
	Excellent organizational and time management skills
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Reliable and punctual with a strong work ethic
	Must be withn the range of 20-30years old
	Female only
	Must stay around Ojodu berger,Ogba and Opic axis


Salary
N60,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitmentkarbakltd@gmail.com using "Office Assistant" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "PWAN Unique is a leading real estate investment and network marketing company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing affordable housing solutions and lucrative investment opportunities. With branches within and outside Lagos, we pride ourselves on excellence, integrity, and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Jakande, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Prepare and issue official receipts for all payments received.
	Calculate and process commissions due to sales executives, agents, and partners.
	Maintain accurate books of accounts, ledgers, and financial statements.
	Oversee accounts payable and receivable activities.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor daily cash flow.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Ensure compliance with tax laws and company policies.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
	Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies as required.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting
	2 - 4 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in the real estate sector.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, or similar)
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and strong organizational skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N270,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrpwanunique@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-16",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Accountant Job at PWAN Unique




        
    

        
        PWAN Unique is a leading real estate investment and network marketing company in Nigeria, dedicated to providing affordable housing solutions and lucrative investment opportunities. With branches within and outside Lagos, we pride ourselves on excellence, integrity, and customer satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Jakande, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and issue official receipts for all payments received.
	Calculate and process commissions due to sales executives, agents, and partners.
	Maintain accurate books of accounts, ledgers, and financial statements.
	Oversee accounts payable and receivable activities.
	Conduct bank reconciliations and monitor daily cash flow.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Ensure compliance with tax laws and company policies.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
	Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies as required.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting
	2 - 4 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in the real estate sector.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, or similar)
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	High attention to detail, integrity, and strong organizational skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N270,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrpwanunique@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Client Service Executive / Manager",
  "description": "VEIN is Lagos&rsquo; new heartbeat for premium nightlife &mdash; a space where great music, creative energy, and impeccable service come together. We deliver an elevated club experience driven by ambiance, talent, and world-class hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Service Executive / Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a charismatic, polished, socially confident Client Service Executive for our Clubhouse (VEIN); someone who understands premium nightlife culture and can effortlessly relate with high-profile guests, lifestyle influencers, VIP clients, and the entertainment community.
	This role is perfect for someone who is:
	
		Naturally attractive and well-groomed
		Highly exposed to the nightlife, lifestyle, and social scene
		Great at conversations, networking, and people engagement
		Energetic, confident, and emotionally intelligent
		Mature and responsible enough for nightlife hospitality expectations
	
	
	If you&rsquo;re the type that walks into a room and lights it up, makes people feel welcome, and thrives in social environments &mdash; this role was designed for you.


Core Responsibilities
Guest Interaction &amp; Experience:


	Welcome guests warmly and escort them through the club/lounge with a high sense of class and professionalism.
	Engage customers, create memorable interactions, and maintain a hospitable presence throughout their stay.
	Attend to special requests, birthday/VIP celebrations, bottle service coordination, table service alignment, and high-end hospitality rituals.
	Maintain strong situational awareness of guest needs, moods, and expectations.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain relationships with VIP clients, lifestyle figures, promoters, event hosts, and social connectors.
	Conduct soft follow-ups with returning guests to maintain loyalty.
	Identify and nurture high-value customers for recurring patronage.


Brand Representation &amp; Grooming Standards:


	Uphold the brand&rsquo;s premium aesthetic through exceptional grooming, poise, confidence, and excellent articulation.
	Represent the club at internal events, promotional activations, and VIP hosting functions when needed


Sales &amp; Upselling:


	Recommend premium bottle options, table packages, celebratory add-ons, and club experiences.
	Support the events team with guest list conversions, table bookings, and reservation confirmations.
	Assist in driving revenue by intelligently upselling packages without being pushy


Social Intelligence &amp; Nightlife Coordination:


	Navigate nightlife dynamics with class, emotional intelligence, and discretion.
	Handle social pressure, high-energy environments, and varying personalities with maturity.
	Mitigate guest dissatisfaction by listening, resolving concerns, and escalating professionally when needed


Operational Support:


	Ensure client areas are guest-ready at all times.
	Coordinate with bar, floor, dancers liaison, and bottle service team.
	Participate in pre-event briefings, brand engagements, and post-event debriefs.


Ideal Candidate Profile


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 3-5 years of experience.
	Polished, attractive, and exceptionally well-groomed
	Comfortable in premium nightlife environments
	Highly social, extroverted, and naturally charming
	Confident around high-net-worth individuals and lifestyle influencers
	Emotionally intelligent with excellent conversation skills
	Observant, intuitive, and quick-thinking
	Poised and composed under pressure
	Must possess the maturity level suitable for nightlife hospitality (typically mid-20s to mid-30s)
	Discreet, trustworthy, and professional
	Must have strong personal etiquette and communication skills
	Previous experience in hospitality, nightlife, events, airline customer service, or luxury retail is an added advantage.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@folixxhospitality.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Client Service Executive / Manager Job at VEIN




        
    

        
        VEIN is Lagos’ new heartbeat for premium nightlife — a space where great music, creative energy, and impeccable service come together. We deliver an elevated club experience driven by ambiance, talent, and world-class hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Service Executive / Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a charismatic, polished, socially confident Client Service Executive for our Clubhouse (VEIN); someone who understands premium nightlife culture and can effortlessly relate with high-profile guests, lifestyle influencers, VIP clients, and the entertainment community.
	This role is perfect for someone who is:
	
		Naturally attractive and well-groomed
		Highly exposed to the nightlife, lifestyle, and social scene
		Great at conversations, networking, and people engagement
		Energetic, confident, and emotionally intelligent
		Mature and responsible enough for nightlife hospitality expectations
	
	
	If you’re the type that walks into a room and lights it up, makes people feel welcome, and thrives in social environments — this role was designed for you.


Core Responsibilities
Guest Interaction & Experience:


	Welcome guests warmly and escort them through the club/lounge with a high sense of class and professionalism.
	Engage customers, create memorable interactions, and maintain a hospitable presence throughout their stay.
	Attend to special requests, birthday/VIP celebrations, bottle service coordination, table service alignment, and high-end hospitality rituals.
	Maintain strong situational awareness of guest needs, moods, and expectations.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain relationships with VIP clients, lifestyle figures, promoters, event hosts, and social connectors.
	Conduct soft follow-ups with returning guests to maintain loyalty.
	Identify and nurture high-value customers for recurring patronage.


Brand Representation & Grooming Standards:


	Uphold the brand’s premium aesthetic through exceptional grooming, poise, confidence, and excellent articulation.
	Represent the club at internal events, promotional activations, and VIP hosting functions when needed


Sales & Upselling:


	Recommend premium bottle options, table packages, celebratory add-ons, and club experiences.
	Support the events team with guest list conversions, table bookings, and reservation confirmations.
	Assist in driving revenue by intelligently upselling packages without being pushy


Social Intelligence & Nightlife Coordination:


	Navigate nightlife dynamics with class, emotional intelligence, and discretion.
	Handle social pressure, high-energy environments, and varying personalities with maturity.
	Mitigate guest dissatisfaction by listening, resolving concerns, and escalating professionally when needed


Operational Support:


	Ensure client areas are guest-ready at all times.
	Coordinate with bar, floor, dancers liaison, and bottle service team.
	Participate in pre-event briefings, brand engagements, and post-event debriefs.


Ideal Candidate Profile


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3-5 years of experience.
	Polished, attractive, and exceptionally well-groomed
	Comfortable in premium nightlife environments
	Highly social, extroverted, and naturally charming
	Confident around high-net-worth individuals and lifestyle influencers
	Emotionally intelligent with excellent conversation skills
	Observant, intuitive, and quick-thinking
	Poised and composed under pressure
	Must possess the maturity level suitable for nightlife hospitality (typically mid-20s to mid-30s)
	Discreet, trustworthy, and professional
	Must have strong personal etiquette and communication skills
	Previous experience in hospitality, nightlife, events, airline customer service, or luxury retail is an added advantage.


Salary
N500,000 - N600,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@folixxhospitality.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "SixthLab Medical (also appearing as Sixth?Lab?Ventures) is a Nigeria-based company specialising in the supply and servicing of diagnostic and therapeutic medical equipment and consumables.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT &amp; Social Media Support Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We&rsquo;re looking for a creative and technically-savvy professional to help us grow our digital presence and support internal IT needs.
	This is a hybrid role with major focus on social media management (70%) and basic IT support (30%). You&rsquo;ll craft content, engage with our online community, generate leads, and also provide first-level tech assistance to our team.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage our social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn) &mdash; content creation, posting, engagement
	Generate and track leads from social media; support the sales team
	Monitor social media performance &amp; produce regular analytics reports
	Respond to customer inquiries via social channels
	Provide frontline IT support: troubleshoot PCs, printers, internet, and email issues
	Install and maintain basic software; manage digital assets


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, IT, Communications, or related field
	2&ndash;3 years of experience in social media management + basic IT support
	Strong content creation skills (graphics, copywriting)
	Familiarity with social media analytics tools
	Good problem-solving and customer service attitude
	Basic troubleshooting skills (hardware, software, connectivity).


Salary Range


	N120,000 &ndash; N150,000 (This will be reviewed upwards after the probation period based on Satisfactory performance)


Why Join Us:


	Work in a niche and growing healthcare-technology company
	Play a key role in growing our online lead generation
	Opportunity to learn both digital marketing and IT in a professional environment
	Collaborative team and supportive management.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short portfolio of your social media work (content you&rsquo;ve created or managed) to:&nbsp;hrsixthlab@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email",

IT & Social Media Support Officer Job at SixthLab Medical




        
    

        
        SixthLab Medical (also appearing as Sixth?Lab?Ventures) is a Nigeria-based company specialising in the supply and servicing of diagnostic and therapeutic medical equipment and consumables.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT & Social Media Support Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a creative and technically-savvy professional to help us grow our digital presence and support internal IT needs.
	This is a hybrid role with major focus on social media management (70%) and basic IT support (30%). You’ll craft content, engage with our online community, generate leads, and also provide first-level tech assistance to our team.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage our social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn) — content creation, posting, engagement
	Generate and track leads from social media; support the sales team
	Monitor social media performance & produce regular analytics reports
	Respond to customer inquiries via social channels
	Provide frontline IT support: troubleshoot PCs, printers, internet, and email issues
	Install and maintain basic software; manage digital assets


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, IT, Communications, or related field
	2–3 years of experience in social media management + basic IT support
	Strong content creation skills (graphics, copywriting)
	Familiarity with social media analytics tools
	Good problem-solving and customer service attitude
	Basic troubleshooting skills (hardware, software, connectivity).


Salary Range


	N120,000 – N150,000 (This will be reviewed upwards after the probation period based on Satisfactory performance)


Why Join Us:


	Work in a niche and growing healthcare-technology company
	Play a key role in growing our online lead generation
	Opportunity to learn both digital marketing and IT in a professional environment
	Collaborative team and supportive management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short portfolio of your social media work (content you’ve created or managed) to: hrsixthlab@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Digital Marketing Specialist",
  "description": "Sproxil is a global brand protection &amp; consumer engagement solutions provider specialized in the provision of cutting edge advanced technology to combat counterfeiting, product theft and adulterations; as well as providing a platform for consumer engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies to build brand awareness and generate leads.
	Manage and grow the company&rsquo;s online presence across websites and social media platforms.
	Design creative graphics, marketing materials, and motion visuals for campaigns.
	Produce, edit, and publish video content for social media, website, and promotional campaigns.
	Write marketing proposals, campaign reports, and promotional content.
	Optimize website content and structure for SEO to improve search rankings and visibility.
	Plan, monitor, and analyze digital campaigns to improve conversion rates and ROI.
	Drive lead generation strategies via email marketing, paid ads, and organic reach.
	Stay updated with digital marketing trends, social media algorithms, and competitor strategies.
	Collaborate with sales and business development teams to ensure marketing efforts align with company goals.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or related field.
	3+ years of experience in digital marketing and content creation.
	Proficiency in graphics design tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva).
	Strong skills in video editing &amp; motion graphics (Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut, or similar).
	Proven experience in SEO optimization and Google Analytics/SEO tools.
	Knowledge of social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer, Meta Business Suite).
	Experience in lead generation and digital campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads).
	Excellent writing and proposal development skills.
	Strong creativity, attention to detail, and storytelling ability.


Salary
N350,000 / Month.

Benefits


	Competitive salary
	HMO
	Work life Balance
	Hybrid work
	13th month&nbsp;
	Great work culture

Digital Marketing Specialist Job at Sproxil




        
    

        
        Sproxil is a global brand protection & consumer engagement solutions provider specialized in the provision of cutting edge advanced technology to combat counterfeiting, product theft and adulterations; as well as providing a platform for consumer engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full time

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies to build brand awareness and generate leads.
	Manage and grow the company’s online presence across websites and social media platforms.
	Design creative graphics, marketing materials, and motion visuals for campaigns.
	Produce, edit, and publish video content for social media, website, and promotional campaigns.
	Write marketing proposals, campaign reports, and promotional content.
	Optimize website content and structure for SEO to improve search rankings and visibility.
	Plan, monitor, and analyze digital campaigns to improve conversion rates and ROI.
	Drive lead generation strategies via email marketing, paid ads, and organic reach.
	Stay updated with digital marketing trends, social media algorithms, and competitor strategies.
	Collaborate with sales and business development teams to ensure marketing efforts align with company goals.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or related field.
	3+ years of experience in digital marketing and content creation.
	Proficiency in graphics design tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva).
	Strong skills in video editing & motion graphics (Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut, or similar).
	Proven experience in SEO optimization and Google Analytics/SEO tools.
	Knowledge of social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Buffer, Meta Business Suite).
	Experience in lead generation and digital campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads).
	Excellent writing and proposal development skills.
	Strong creativity, attention to detail, and storytelling ability.


Salary
N350,000 / Month.

Benefits


	Competitive salary
	HMO
	Work life Balance
	Hybrid work
	13th month 
	Great work culture
